rules: Rule1: Whenever paper1 undergoes the first round at journal1, journal1 performs initial screening on paper1.
Rule2: Under the condition that journal1 performs initial screening on paper1, if the situation where paper1 has data does not entail that paper1 meets standards, then paper1 gets rejection.
Rule3: Whenever journal1 makes an editor recommendation on paper1, then if paper1 needs major revision, it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.
Rule4: If the author of paper1 makes an appeal, then the appeal for paper1 is successful.
Rule5: Either the author of paper1 makes an appeal or journal1 makes an editor recommendation on paper1.
Rule6: Whenever journal1 makes a rejection decision on paper1, then if journal1 makes a final decision on paper1, the appeal for paper1 does not succeed.
Rule7: If paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 needs major revision.
Rule8: Provided that paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 is accepted.
Rule9: If paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 has data.
Rule10: Either paper1 is reviewed or paper1 is not published.
Rule11: Either paper1 is revised, or if paper1 is reviewed then it is not accepted.
Rule12: If paper1 meets standards, then paper1 is not accepted.
Rule13: If journal1 is assigned to paper1 by an editor, then paper1 undergoes the first round at journal1.
Rule14: Either journal1 is assigned to paper1 by an editor or journal1 is assigned to paper1 by a reviewer.
Rule15: Whenever journal1 is assigned to paper1 by a reviewer, then if the implication that paper1 has data entails meeting standards fails, paper1 gets rejection.
Rule16: Under the condition that paper1 having data does not necessitate meeting standards, it is not the case that paper1 gets rejection.
Rule17: If journal1 does not make a rejection decision on paper1, then journal1 makes an acceptance decision on paper1.
Rule18: Provided that conference1 does not have a submission deadline, paper1 is published.
facts: Fact1: Journal1 makes a final decision on paper1.
Fact2: Journal1 does not make an acceptance decision on paper1.
